answers.answer: There are lots of issues that can cause tiredness.The simplest one is lack of sleep.Illnesses, like bacterial or viral infections, not eating properly and having low iron and other deficiencies.  Overdoing things can make you feel tired as well as boredom and depression.If you are tired and have lost your appetite that is a good indicator of low iron levels.  A blood test would confirm whether you are iron deficient or not.  Make sure that you eat properly.Being dehydrated can also cause tiredness, so make sure you drink plenty of water.Tiredness is not an illness in itself, it is a symptom of something.Best wishes.
Not enough sleep. Too much sleep. Poor nutrition (I.e. not enough food, too much unhealthy food)

I have suffered depression since I was fifteen, and the one huge indicator for me that I need to change something in my medication is that I begin to feel tired all the time, even when I sleep a lot.  could this be whats bothering you?Missing the right levels of vitamin D and Iron can also make you very tired, if you are feeling thirsty and tired it could be an indication of Diabetes.I would start with a blood test, or if you dont want to go the doctor route just yet, invest on a good multivitamin that contains Iron.Hope you feel better soon,
